definition: to disappear/to vanish/to eliminate/to spend (time)/have to/need

sentences.english: For in just a very little while, “He who is coming will come and will not delay.” Hebrews 10:36-37 (NIV)
sentences.chinese: 只消一小會兒，“將會到來的不會耽擱。”

sentences.english: I'll just steer south and west, " he said."
sentences.chinese: “我只消朝西南航行就成，”他說。

sentences.english: I have but to speak the word, and your head will lie at your feet.
sentences.chinese: 只消我說一個字，管叫你人頭落地。

sentences.english: All I must do is keep the head clear.
sentences.chinese: 我只消保持頭腦清醒就行。

sentences.english: In the end, one gets to know these people almost at a glance.
sentences.chinese: 到最後你幾乎只消瞥一眼就能認出這種人。

sentences.english: If you will thank me, let it be for yourself alone.
sentences.chinese: 如果你當真要謝我，你只消表明你自己的謝忱。

sentences.english: We only need to watch the weather forecasts.
sentences.chinese: 只消看看天氣預報就明白了。

definition: in the wink of an eye/in a flash
solely engrossed in one thing/just (one thing, no need to worry about the rest)/simply/by all means/please feel free/do not hesitate (to ask for sth)
no harm (in doing it)/One might as well./It won't hurt./no matter/it's no bother
